conclusion: Understanding how shadows change with light source movement is key to solving the problem.
The light source is positioned above the objects, casting shadows on the ground.
The light source's position affects the size and position of the shadows.
The size of the shadow is proportional to the size of the object casting the shadow.
The shadow's position will change as the light source moves.
When the light source moves, the shadow will shift in position.
The shadow's size will also change, but the relative size of the shadow to the object it is casting will remain constant.
The shadow of the object labeled A will move to the right.
The shadow of the object labeled B will move to the right.
The shadow of the object labeled C will move to the right.
The shadow of the object labeled D will move to the right.
When the light source moves forward above the objects, the shadows will shift to the right.
The size of the shadows will remain the same relative to the objects they are casting.
The shadows will move to the right.
